title: Battle for Kids
content:
What font is this in the left corner of this website  
 [www.batelleforkids.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.batelleforkids.com/ "www.batelleforkids.com")?

Let me know ASAP

 [‹ popular font, please help](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/typophile.com/node/50226 "Go to previous forum topic") [NFL Typeface seen on Combine Jerseys and Sideline Gear ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/typophile.com/node/50218 "Go to next forum topic")
author: first_j

comments.content: I’m not sure what type you are specifically referring to, but the CSS file is spec’ing both “Arial, Helvetica” and “Tahoma” in different places.
I am talking about the logo in the upper left corner the one that is blue, green and red
Are you sure that the URL is right? [www.batelleforkids.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.batelleforkids.com/ "www.batelleforkids.com")?

[edit]

Oh, now I found it: your url lacks a ‘t’: [http://www.battelleforkids.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.battelleforkids.com/ "http://www.battelleforkids.com/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bat_6343.png)
  
‘for’ is [Caflisch Script Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/caflisch_script_pro_bold/?sample_text=for&sample_size=144)

[www.batelleforkids.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.batelleforkids.com/ "www.batelleforkids.com")  
 [www.battelleforkids.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.battelleforkids.com/ "www.battelleforkids.com")

Surprising?! Neither one reads Battle For Kids  
What is the additional le stands for?!

[Vershen](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210163328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pixymbols/vershen/) is a bit similar too.

- Mike Yanega
